sentence.Network_cn: 那电影完全是一堆垃圾。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from Yiddish drek 'filth, dregs', from a Germanic base shared by Old English threax; probably related to Greek skatos 'dung'

means.word_mean: 1. merchandise that is shoddy or inferior

auth_sentence.content: Look no further than the dreck I just read concerning extreme weather.
auth_sentence.res_content: Look no further than the dreck I just read concerning extreme weather.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Look no further than the dreck I just read concerning extreme weather.

auth_sentence.content: Researchers are using cutting edge statistical analysis to tease out patterns in weather records, and you see "dreck"?
auth_sentence.res_content: Researchers are using cutting edge statistical analysis to tease out patterns in weather records, and you see "dreck"?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Researchers are using cutting edge statistical analysis to tease out patterns in weather records, and you see "dreck"?

auth_sentence.content: What I heard was a gut-churning mix of Wham, Boy George, Loverboy, White Snake, Air Supply, Debbie Gibson, and similar dreck.
auth_sentence.res_content: What I heard was a gut-churning mix of Wham, Boy George, Loverboy, White Snake, Air Supply, Debbie Gibson, and similar dreck.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What I heard was a gut-churning mix of Wham, Boy George, Loverboy, White Snake, Air Supply, Debbie Gibson, and similar dreck.
